**True if and only if the text contains at least one special character (punctuation or symbol) AND at least one word appears more than once in the text.**

In other words:
- Special characters include: `.` `,` `;` `!` `?` `:` etc.
- Word repetition means the same word (case-insensitive, ignoring special characters attached to it) appears 2+ times

**Revised Rule:**

**True if and only if the text contains at least one special character (punctuation or symbol) embedded within or attached to words.**

More precisely: **True if there exists at least one word that has special characters interspersed within it or attached to it (not just at the end as a sentence terminator).**

Examples:
- "the la,zy p;ytho!n" → True (la,zy, p;ytho!n have embedded special chars)
- "dog fox output cat run." → False (only period at end, no embedded special chars)
- "output output. ma,t ou;,tput" → True (ma,t and ou;,tput have embedded special chars)
